meanings.definition: The practice of excluding or restricting others based on certain criteria.
meanings.sent1: Exclusivism can lead to feelings of isolation and loneliness.
meanings.sent2: The exclusivism of the country club made it difficult for new members to join.
meanings.sent3: The exclusivism of the exclusive club was so extreme that even the squirrels were denied entry.
meanings.sent4: Her exclusivism in choosing friends left her with a small but loyal circle.
meanings.sent5: The exclusivism of the VIP section made everyone else feel like outsiders.

meanings.definition: The belief that one particular group or ideology is superior to others.
meanings.sent1: Exclusivism often leads to conflicts and misunderstandings between different groups.
meanings.sent2: The exclusivism of the political party alienated potential supporters.
meanings.sent3: The exclusivism of the cat who thought it was better than all other animals was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His exclusivism towards other teams made him blind to their strengths.
meanings.sent5: The exclusivism of the queen bee was evident in how she treated the other bees in the hive.

meanings.definition: The tendency to prioritize one's own interests over those of others.
meanings.sent1: Exclusivism can sometimes lead to selfish behavior and disregard for others.
meanings.sent2: Her exclusivism in decision-making often caused conflicts within the team.
meanings.sent3: The exclusivism of the picky eater who only ate green foods was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: His exclusivism in choosing movie night always resulted in watching his favorite genre.
meanings.sent5: The exclusivism of the CEO in promoting only his relatives created tension among employees.
